title: Eksamen IIKG3020 (2024) â€” Multiple Choice Questions (25 points)
description: Multiple Choice Questions from the IIKG3020 exam 2024. Use for practice and self-testing.

questions.question: What comes second of these actions in the NIST incident response lifecycle
What is the first and most important step that CERT/CC recommends when starting the process of implementing a CSIRT?
Which of these metrics would be the most relevant to report to upper management after a cyber incident?
choices: Number of IDS alerts related to the detected incident
Number of person-hours diverted from normal operations to respond to the incident
Number of false positives diverting SOC personell from the incident
Number of SIEM threat hunting searches performed

questions.question: Which TLP marking should be used for sharing information that should only be spread on a need-to-know basis within an organisation and its clients?
What is an example of an atomic indicator?
What would a CVSS score of 10.0 indicate?
choices: This is a vulnerability of minor severity
This is a very critical vulnerability
This is a very common software security weakness

questions.question: What comes first of these in the Mandiant cyber attack life cycle?
What is the main goal of intrusion reconstruction according to the intrusion kill chain model?
choices: Reduce the number of steps the adversary must go through
Increase the adversarial courses of actions across the kill chain
Push detection from the latter phases of the kill chain into earlier ones
Move detection down the kill chain

questions.question: Which of these indicators would cause the adversary the most amount of pain when you implement detection and response?
Which of these strategies is typically used in threat hunting?
choices: Analysis driven by Al using ML

questions.question: Which of these assumptions form the basis of the MITRE ATT&CK model?
choices: Automated measuring of endpoint data gives telemetry that can not be distinguished from the typical background noise
Adversaries tend to exhibit consistent patterns of behaviour while interacting with victim systems
Defense gaps can be discovered by emulating the attacker pre-compromise behaviour
Pre-compromise operations can be modelled by observing the attacker interactions with endpoints

questions.question: What is the distinction between a MITRE ATT&CK technique and an IOC?
choices: IOCs are less dependent on specific malware or hacker tools
ATT&CK techniques cannot be used as input to intrusion detection signature
IOCs have less utility for defenders
Many ATT&CK techniques are legitimate system functions, while IOCs are typically associated with adversary actions

questions.question: What should be the focus of the incident containment phase?
choices: Recovering control of the affected systems

questions.question: What is STIX/TAXII?
choices: A tool to perform campaign analysis using the cyber kill chain model
An extensible XML schema developed by Mandiant
An industry standard for sharing IOCs

questions.question: What is the most basic and foundational incident response capability in the hierarchy of needs?
What is usually the purpose of tuning IDS alarms?
What type of IDPS is most likely to detect malware containing a zero-day exploit?
What is the least complex adversary tripwire type IDPS?
What type of IDPS presents a single pane of glass view for alert triage and management and automates response actions?
Which IOCs can typically be used for cross-pivoting when analysing malicious network infrastructure?
choices: TTPs, File hashes and Regular expressions
IDS rules, File hashes and DLLs
Domain names, IP addresses and SSL certificates

questions.question: What is the purpose of threat intelligence forecasting?
choices: Getting ahead of the attack lifecycle
Input to the root cause analysis
Getting ahead of the indicator life cycle
Responding after the point of compromise

questions.question: Which of these is typically a host-based indicator?
What is the most important step in the threat intelligence cycle?
What is an example of CSIRT reactive services?
Which one of these claims related to legal frameworks for CSIRT information sharing is true?
choices: IP addresses are not considered personal data according to GDPR
The NIS2 directive gives a stronger legal provision for CSIRT information sharing than GDPR
GDPR is not applicable to CSIRT information sharing
GDPR does not allow CSIRTs to share information containing personal data
